summary: This is a search and seizure warrant issued by the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the search of Jeffrey Epstein's residence at 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY. The warrant seeks evidence related to violations of sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy, specifically targeting electronic devices and media containing communications, photographs, and records concerning victims.

persons.name: Henry Pitman
persons.context: Issued the search and seizure warrant for the premises at 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY, related to the investigation into sex trafficking offenses.

events.title: Issuance of Search Warrant
events.description: A federal search and seizure warrant was issued by Magistrate Judge Henry Pitman, authorizing the search of the residence at 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY, for evidence related to sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

events.title: Warrant Execution Deadline
events.description: The warrant commanded execution on or before July 12, 2019, indicating the timeframe during which the search of the premises was authorized to occur.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: The warrant authorizes the search of Jeffrey Epstein's New York City residence at 9 East 71st Street for evidence of sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.
The specific statutes cited are Title 18, United States Code, Sections 371 (conspiracy) and 1591 (sex trafficking of minors).
The warrant targets electronic devices and storage media, including computers, phones, and drives, for communications, photographs, and records related to victims and potential victims.
It authorizes the seizure of 'child erotica,' defined as suggestive visual depictions of nude minors that do not meet the legal definition of child pornography.
The warrant allows for delayed notification to the person whose property is searched, indicating concerns about potential adverse effects if immediate notice were given.
